alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 2:16PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of western Warren, northeastern Berks, Lehigh, Carbon, northwestern Bucks, Monroe and Northampton Counties through 300 PM EST... At 215 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near White Haven to Lyons. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Forks, Emmaus, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Quakertown, Byram, Wilson, Bedminster, Hellertown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe and Slatington. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 42 and 96. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 40 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 6. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
